query: I'm in the market for a new pen, and I want something that looks great, writes smoothly, and is comfortable to use. It's also important to me that the pen has a consistent performance and good value for the price. I heard about the Parker 51, but based on this review, it seems like the Jinhao 51A is a much better option. The Jinhao 51A has all the features I'm looking for, and it's available at a fraction of the price of the Parker 51. Overall, I want a pen that I can rely on and that performs well, so I think I'll go with the Jinhao 51A.
ori_review:
"New Parker 51 competition? No competition..it's far better I ordered a new Parker 51 and this Jinhao 51A at about the same time.

The Jinhao 51A was everything I expected of a Parker 51 - great looks, smooth, consistent, comfortable, and just overall great value. And the price? About 1/9th that of a Parker 51. I ordered a fine nib and that's what I got. Wrote well out of the box. Arrived via Amazon in 2 days.

New Parker 51: Took a full week to arrive (not an Amazon purchase), sent it back for exchange in a few days because of hard or no starts pretty much any time I let it sit for as little as 2 minutes, never mind overnight, when a full flush was sometimes needed to get it started. The nib vacillated from fine to medium in the same sentence. The sweet spot on the nib was so tiny it changed the way I write.

My replacement was somewhat better, but honestly, just a little. Sometimes it writes well, sometimes not, pick a day, it'll be different. Got the burgundy, so, yeah, a GREAT looking pen.

But you see where I'm going with this. The Jinhao 51A is a superior pen in nearly every way, and gets used frequently (not constantly, I have a number of inexpensive and medium priced pens from several manufacturers that perform far better than the somewhat expensive Part 51).

Given some of the unexplainable design choices Parker made for the new 51, I only pull it out because I'm thinking, ""this will be the day it starts to write well (and it's pretty) and it was far from free!"". That day has yet to come.

The Jinhao 51A is a great pen, looks beautiful, consistent, and ready when you are. So...no competition."

query: "I need to find a basic office chair that is suitable for someone of average height or shorter. It should be easy to assemble with clear instructions. Appearance-wise, it should have a sharp and classy look that would fit well in a professional office or at home. Function-wise, it should swivel easily, slide well across the floor, feel stable, and have smooth and easy-to-use adjustment mechanisms. The chair should also have the option to raise and lower the arms. It would be a plus if it comes with spare parts. However, I am looking for a chair that provides good cushioning and comfort, as I suffer from chronic pain. The chair should have a supportive lower back design and a seat cushion made of solid material with some give. It should not be too stiff, especially since I will be sitting on it for long periods. Additionally, it should be suitable for someone of taller height, as I am 5'9"" and need a chair that provides proper support for the upper back and legs. Overall, I am looking for a well-made office chair that meets these criteria."
ori_review:
"Solid basic office chair, good for someone of average height or shorter I got this chair to replace my current office chair which, after over a decade, has seen better days. When I took everything out of the box, at first I was a little overwhelmed and thought it might be a little difficult to assemble with all the parts. Turned out it wasn't at all. The instructions were very simple, clear and easy to understand with a good numbering system for reference. In fact, the instructions were so easy to understand that I missed a couple steps (thinking I had it all figured out) and caused myself grief (like forgetting the washers in Step 4 so I had to take out the screws and do it again).

UPDATE: Since this chair didn't work for me, I gave it to my daughter to use when she's working at her craft table and she loves it! She said the size works fine for her (she's just a little shorter than me), it's sturdy and comfortable and she loves how the arms go up and down. So I've changed my review to five stars.

I think it took about an hour to assemble, but that was with multiple interruptions (and, of course, causing myself grief by not following the steps). Just a heads-up, on Step 3 where it says to tighten the screws attaching the armrests to the chair back and cover them with decorative caps, don't follow that part. Follow the instruction right below it in the same box that tells you to NOT tighten the screws until the chair is fully assembled. You need them a little bit loose for when you assemble the seat bottom in Step 4. Then you can fully tighten all screws and place the decorative caps.

As for appearance, the chair looks really sharp, really classy and would look great in a professional office setting or at home. As for function, it swivels easily, slides across the floor well, feels very stable, and all adjustment mechanisms were smooth and easy to operate. It also has arms which can be raised and lowered and it comes with spare parts, which is always a good thing just in case.

So why did I give it a 4 instead of a 5? Two reasons. As I said, I bought this chair to replace my comfy old chair that's no so cushiony anymore, but for me and the chronic pain I suffer from, this chair just didn't work. I sat in it and worked for about an hour and a half and was in a whole lot of pain when I got up, which was difficult because I also got very stiff sitting in it. The chair back does have a really good design that's very supportive of the lower back and that's a great feature and the seat cushion is made of very solid material which has some give as you're seated, but it's pretty stiff. And while it may and likely would ""soften up"" with time, it is just too hard for me to take sitting on for long stretches like my job requires let alone to do it for a potentially long break-in period.

And the other issue is it was a little too small for me. I'm 5'9"" and both the back and seat cushion were just too short. The seat cushion was several inches short of the backs of my knees and the chair back came up to midshoulder on me, so it wasn't super comfortable or supportive for the upper back and legs as a taller person. It might be great for someone maybe 5'6"" and under, though.

Overall, it's a solid, good-looking, well-made office chair that did exceed my expectations but sadly fell short in a couple important areas."

query: I'm looking for a clicker that is easy to set up and doesn't drain batteries quickly. The previous clicker I had lasted a long time, but the rubber finish became sticky and degraded over time. I want a clicker that has forward/back, enter, and volume up/down buttons, as well as a power switch and a laser pointer button. I also want the USB dongle to be conveniently stored in the device, with a swivel handle for easy connection to a USB port. It would be great if the clicker works well with Mac devices without any keyboard mapping issues. The laser should be strong enough to be used as a pointer, and the battery should last for at least 3 hours of use. Overall, I'm looking for a small and handy presentation device.
ori_review:
"Seamless setup and sips batteries This clicker replaces one I put into service a decade ago. That device has a couple more controls on it, but also a rubberized finish that is now sticky and degraded. This stick has forward/back, enter, and volume up/down buttons, plus a power switch and a laser pointer button.

The USB dongle is in the bottom of the device and is retained magnetically. A little swivel handle on it makes it easy to plug into an available USB-A port. Folding back the swivel reveals a USB-C connector.

My Mac devices want to identify a keyboard when the dongle is plugged in. The MacOS method for doing this is to have the user press specific keys so the OS can match them to a keyboard map. When this didn't work (because the device uses ""keyboard"" methods but only has 5 keys), I gave up and chose ""European"" keyboard method in the dialog that suggested I contact the manufacturer. After that, it mapped correctly and worked perfectly. Go figure.

The laser is sufficiently strong to use as a pointer. The manufacturer claims 3+ hours of use before having to change the single AAA battery.

query: I am looking for a printer that can be used with a Chromebook computer. I want to connect it with a USB cable and be able to easily print without any complications. ori_review:
"How to print with a Chromebook This printer can be used with a Chromebook computer, but it has to be with a USB cable, not supplied with the printer.

Just connect the printer to a USB port on the Chromebook computer using a USB cable. Then turn on the power. The printer will initialize and the little LED display will say ""READY"". If the window says ""sleep"" or anything but ""ready"", unplug the power cord from the 120 volt outlet, and plug it back in again.

In settings, turn WIFI off, because we don't want to use the WIFI with the printer.

In settings, bring up the ""add printer"" setting. Notice that the Brother printer will appear as one of the choices. Select the Brother printer. Then just start printing. One of the printer options will be two sided printing. Select this if you wish.

It worked right off the bat for me. Hope it does for you also"

query: "I'm in search of decal paper that I can use for my projects. I want something that is convenient and ready to use, without the need to wait for the decals to dry after applying sealer. The paper should not be excessively sticky, but I would be open to using additional solutions like ""Micro Sol"" and ""Micro Set"" to make the decals easier to work with. While I am used to glossy decal paper, I understand that a matte finish is necessary for compatibility with inkjet printers. However, it would be great if the manufacturer, Koala, could consider making a glossier version that sticks better to surfaces. I would also be interested in a transparent or clear version in the future. I understand that some reviewers may not know how to properly use or make decals, so I will make my own judgment once I purchase the decal paper."
ori_review:
Solid 8/10 This decal paper is easily my new favorite decal paper to use for projects. The convenience of having ready to go Decals is unmatched.

You will no longer need to wait for the Decals to dry after spraying 15 thousand coat of Cancerous sealer before using them. The film itself is not very sticky as opposed to other Decal paper’s I’ve used in the past.

I highly recommend using a solution such as “Micro Sol” and “Micro Set” to soften the decals and make them more easier to work with. I won’t explain how to use Micro Sol and Micro Set in this review as their are plenty of YouTube videos to search for giving you step by step instructions on how to use those solutions.

The Matte finish threw me off a bit as I am used to working with highly Glossy Decal paper but it’s understandable considering the paper is compatible with Inkjet printers so their needed to be some chances to the paper itself.

I would recommend Koala to keep upgrading the product and maybe using a material that will be a bit more Glossy and that will stick better to the surface one is applying the decal to.

I would love to see Koala make a Transparent or “Clear” version in the near future.

I’ve read some of the reviews and will say to come up with your own judgement once you purchase the decal paper. Most reviewers don’t know how to properly use or make Decals so keep that in mind.

query: I am looking for a deck of cards that looks beautiful and comes with a wooden stand for display. I want to be able to swap the cards easily and have suggestions for essential oils and crystals for each affirmation. It's important to me that the cards have gilded, rounded edges and are made of heavy cardstock. I love the holographic design on the front and the affirmations on the back. I want something unique and well-thought-out. However, I don't need the box to store the crystals and stand, so I wish the cards came with their own storage box. I have my own selenite pieces at home, but I'm not a fan of the included raw wand because it's uncomfortable to hold. Overall, I think these cards are amazing and would give them a high rating.
ori_review:
"Beautiful, gorgeous deck of cards Gorgeous, gorgeous cards. Looks beautiful on display on the included wooden stand. I intend to swap the card out every few days or when I feel I need to. This set of affirmation cards is unique because each card includes suggestions for essential oils and crystals for each affirmation. The cards are really so beautiful, I can't say enough about them. Gilded, rounded edges. Heavy cardstock. The front of each card is holographic. The back has affirmations relating to the main affirmation on the front of the card. These really are special. I feel that a lot of thought went into these cards. Definitely the nicest affirmations cards I've come across.

I do love the idea of the beautiful box it came in, but my box arrived a little smashed and since I wouldn't be storing the crystal and stand in the box, I wish the deck of cards had their own nice box for storage.

I do have a lot of selenite at home. I've been collecting rocks and crystals since I was a child, just because I always felt they were beautiful and special. I probably have at least 15 selenite pieces, but I'm not a fan of the raw wand included in this set. To me, it's uncomfortable to hold. I would rather have it smooth, but maybe that's a matter of personal preference or maybe my wand isn't the same as the one you'll get. I included a picture of the shards in the box that made me feel uncomfortable handling the selenite.

In summary, the cards are beyond compare. The box is lovely for gifting, and for storage of the whole set. Although the box is beautiful, it's not as practical when the items are in use. I don't need such a big box to store just the cards. The stand is simple, pretty, works as intended. The selenite is not my favorite. Overall, I would give it a 4.75, so I feel like I need to round up to a 5. I hope this review helps you decide if this set is for you!

In the attached pictures, you'll see one card (front and back) with a rose quartz from my collection (since rose quartz was recommended for the ""love"" affirmation). The box, which is lovely, but slightly damaged before it got to me. Lastly, the inside of the box with the tiny selenite shards that have come off the selenite wand."

query: I'm looking for a label maker that is cute, easy to use, and rechargeable. It should be portable and compatible with my phone and tablet. I want something that comes with a USB cord for charging and has different label designs. It should be small and easy to carry around, as I plan to use it for car organization and on-the-go purposes. The label maker should have an app that is easy to navigate and allows me to customize the labels with different colors, fonts, and images. It should also have a history feature for reprinting labels and a section for user manual, FAQs, and technical support. It's important that the label maker is rechargeable and doesn't require ink.
ori_review:
"so freaking cute and easy to use + rechargeable, cordless, portable [[VIDEOID:abd16c63feb78c6c4c4a55a2e9c85153]] HPRT Label Maker Machine Easy to Use for Office Home Organization Compatible with Phone Pad Gift Bluetooth Connection, Cute School Supplies

yes, i LOVE it. I am a huge labeler and have several different types of label makers/printers at home. This is the smallest one I have and it's super portable AND adorable. I'm actually keeping this one in my car for car organization and for on-the-go ""emergency"" use.

It comes in a cute pink box with the label maker, manual, USB cord, and 5 label rolls (1 plain white, 4 with designs/patterns). The shape and color of this label printer reminds me of a macaron, and I am obsessed with macaron-designed products, so I immediately loved this mini cylindrical label maker. Thank goodness it works well too.

It's very easy to use. You just charge it with the USB cord (mine arrived already charged), insert a label roll, press the power button for 3-4 seconds, then connect app to printer via bluetooth.

You can install the phone app using the QR code in the manual, or just look for the HerePrint app from the Google Play Store. Once you have the app opened, it's pretty easy to navigate. Make sure your'e connected to the printer (mine was HPRT H11-4723), click on Scan, then scan the QR code on the label roll to create your label.

There's so many features to customize your label: color, font size, font, line/character spacing, add images/bubbles/stickers/date/barcode/etc. You can go to ""History"" and reprint a previous label you made. If you go to ""Me"", you can access an electronic version of the user manual, FAQ, technical support/live chat, and it has an option that takes you directly to their Amazon page to buy printer supplies (i.e. label rolls) as well. The ""Me"" section is very convenient to have available in the app and I appreciate it.

Huge plus that this is rechargeable, can be used cordless, and never will require ink b/c it uses thermal technology. FYI, I have an Android/Samsung phone."

query: "I'm looking for a compact and extendable conference room speaker for my small meeting room. "compact and extendable conference room speaker, pretty cool We had a really small meeting room. yet a computer speaker is not enough for the meeting requirement.
so, I am tasked to buy a compact speakerphone for our tiny conference room.

look at this simple task, I got tons of choices of inexpensive speakerphones on the market that can achieve the task.

Yet, my boss has to bang his head and come up with this idea of future proof. kept talking about what happened if we later had a bigger conference room. and we had to consider the feedback loop if we bring in another speakerphone.

so, then the simple task becomes much more difficult as I am no sound engineer.

after some consultation with friends of ""sound expert"", fingers crossed. I am starting to look at speakerphones with link capability. and it is amazingly hard to find.

eventually, I found this in this Anker device from mountains of devices with similar capabilities.

this speakerphone does support linking up to five devices so we can later extend to a 20-person meeting room from our current 5-people one. so we don't have to worry about the feedback loop between devices in the same room.

phew...., mission complete.

after hooking this device up, the sound quality is pretty good. clear and load.
and the sound effect is very soft not unlike other crapy speakers that come with crispy sound effects just to achieve the loud conference effect.

I can totally use this new meeting room as my after-work movie theater now. ;)"

query: I am looking for a comprehensive planner that is a good size for my desk. I want it to have sections for planning my vision, setting goals, and tracking progress. The paper should have a good weight and not bleed through with most writing utensils. I also want a planner that is undated and includes pages for 12 months. It should have a 2-page monthly spread with space for goals and habits, as well as sections for work and personal to-dos, daily and weekly goals, habit tracking, and reflection. The planner should have a budget section with pages to record income, savings, bills, and expenses, as well as dot-grid pages for customization. It would be great if it also has yearly summary pages in the budget section. I prefer neutral black and grey printing throughout the book. Additionally, I would like the planner to have dot-grid pages at the back for customization and a pocket on the inside back cover. It should come with three page marker ribbons, although I would prefer them to be different colors for easier navigation. A pen loop and elastic band to keep the book closed would also be a plus.
ori_review:
Good comprehensive all-in-one planner This is a nice size planner. It’s not quite as big as letter size paper, but it’s not super small either. This is a good size for a desk, but too big to carry in a purse. It has great sections to help you plan your vision, set goals, and track progress. The paper has a good weight to it and shouldn’t bleed through with most writing utensils. The cover has linen type embossing that gives it a classical style.

Since it is undated, it can be started at any time and includes pages for 12 months. The 2-page monthly spread has a place for goals and habits. Each week has a section for work and person to-dos as well as daily and weekly goals, habit tracker (up to 5 habits), and spaces for reflection and planning for the future. The page size provides plenty of space for writing.

In addition to the regular planning sections, this also has a budget section. Each month’s budget pages have places to record income, savings, bills, and expenses as well as a dot-grid page that can be used to make custom charts, graph, etc. There are also yearly summary pages in the budget section so you can see trends and progress. The printing throughout the book is a neutral black and grey

The back of the book has 20 pages of dot-grid pages that can be used to customize trackers, goals, motivational quotes, etc. There is also a pocket on the inside back cover.

The book comes with three page marker ribbons that are the same color as the cover. I would have preferred 3 different colors to make locating specific sections easier. There is also a pen loop attached to the back cover and an elastic band to help keep the book closed in a tote bag or backpack.

query: I am in need of crystal clear vinyl holders with nice lanyards. I want something that can easily hold my contents without them falling out, although it doesn't need to be waterproof or dirt-proof. It should be easy to slide my contents in without the sides sticking together. The vinyl smell should go away quickly. I don't need breakaway lanyards. The price for 52 holders is good and exceptional for 104, and I would buy more if they came in other colors.
ori_review:
"Crystal clear vinyl holders, nice ""clip"" lanyards 52 is sort of an odd number, but okay! 😄

The 4x3 holders do not have any way to seal the contents in. That works for my needs (meetings), but not so great for theme park tickets, any use that might involve water or dirt, etc. They are, however, easy to slide contents in. (The sides don't stick together as with some holders.) There's a pretty intense vinyl smell, but it seems to dissipate quickly. At the top you have one slot (for a clip or hook lanyard) and two holes (for double-ended lanyards). NOTE that the lanyard holes aren't punched out; They're not hard to push out, but it will make a mess at your registration table if you don't do it in advance.

Love the lanyards. They're black, and there isn't much to be said about that, but their wide and really soft. They have a single bulldog clip at the end, and they are NOT breakaway (if that's important to you).

The price is currently very good for 52 and exceptional for 104. They're a great buy and I'd be getting more of them if they came in other colors."
